weeks.title: Introduction to Computer Science and Go Fundamentals

topics.title: What is Computer Science?
topics.description: An overview of the field of computer science, its history, core concepts, and its impact on the modern world. We'll explore different sub-disciplines and career paths.

topics.title: Introduction to the Go Programming Language
topics.description: An introduction to Go (Golang), its design philosophy, key features (simplicity, concurrency, performance), and why it's a great language for beginners. We'll cover its history and common use cases.

topics.title: Setting up Your Development Environment (VS Code & Terminal)
topics.description: Learn how to install Visual Studio Code (VS Code) and essential extensions for Go development. We'll cover basic terminal commands for navigation, file operations, and running Go programs.

topics.title: Your First Go Program: 'Hello, World!'
topics.description: Write, compile, and run your very first Go program. Understand the basic structure of a Go program, including the `package main`, `import` statement, and the `main` function.

weeks.title: Basic Data Types and Variables in Go

topics.title: Understanding Data Types (Integers, Floats, Booleans)
topics.description: Explore the fundamental data types in Go: integers (signed and unsigned), floating-point numbers, and booleans. Learn about their ranges, memory representation, and common operations.

topics.title: Declaring and Using Variables
topics.description: Learn how to declare variables in Go using `var` and short variable declaration (`:=`). Understand variable scope and initialization. Explore type inference.

topics.title: Constants and Their Usage
topics.description: Understand the concept of constants in Go. Learn how to declare and use constants with `const` and explore untyped constants.

topics.title: Basic Arithmetic and Logical Operators
topics.description: Master the use of arithmetic operators (+, -, *, /, %) and logical operators (&&, ||, !). Understand operator precedence and how to perform calculations.

topics.title: Conditional Statements: `if`, `else if`, `else`
topics.description: Learn how to control the execution flow of your program based on conditions using `if`, `else if`, and `else` statements. Explore conditional expressions.

topics.title: The `switch` Statement in Go
topics.description: Discover the flexibility of the `switch` statement for handling multiple conditions efficiently. Learn about `case`, `default`, and fallthrough behavior.

topics.title: Looping Constructs: `for` Loops
topics.description: Understand the versatile `for` loop in Go. Learn about its different forms: initialization, condition, post-statement; condition only; and infinite loops.

topics.title: `break` and `continue` Statements
topics.description: Learn how to alter the normal flow of loops using `break` to exit a loop and `continue` to skip to the next iteration.

weeks.title: Composite Data Types: Arrays and Slices

topics.title: Arrays in Go
topics.description: Understand fixed-size arrays in Go. Learn how to declare, initialize, and access elements of an array. Explore array iteration.

topics.title: Introduction to Slices
topics.description: Learn about slices, Go's dynamic arrays. Understand the underlying array, length, and capacity. Explore how slices are created and manipulated.

topics.title: Slice Operations: `append` and `copy`
topics.description: Master essential slice operations like appending new elements (`append`) and copying elements between slices (`copy`). Understand the implications of these operations on underlying arrays.

topics.title: Iterating Over Slices using `range`
topics.description: Learn the idiomatic Go way to iterate over slices using the `range` keyword. Understand how to access both index and value, or just the value.

weeks.title: Composite Data Types: Maps and Structs

topics.title: Maps in Go
topics.description: Explore Go's built-in map type for key-value data storage. Learn how to create, populate, access, update, and delete entries in a map.

topics.title: Structs: Defining Custom Data Types
topics.description: Learn how to define custom data types using structs. Understand how to group related data fields together and create your own data structures.

topics.title: Working with Structs: Fields and Methods
topics.description: Discover how to access struct fields and how to associate methods with structs to define behavior. Explore embedded structs.

topics.title: Zero Values and Initialization of Structs
topics.description: Understand the concept of zero values for different data types in Go. Learn various ways to initialize structs, including literal initialization and using `new()`.

weeks.title: Functions and Error Handling in Go

topics.title: Defining and Calling Functions
topics.description: Learn how to define reusable blocks of code in Go. Understand function signatures, parameters, and return values. Explore multiple return values.

topics.title: Variadic Functions and Anonymous Functions
topics.description: Explore variadic functions that accept a variable number of arguments and learn about anonymous functions (closures) and their use cases.

topics.title: Introduction to Error Handling in Go
topics.description: Understand Go's philosophy of explicit error handling using the `error` interface. Learn how functions return errors and how to check for them.

topics.title: Common Error Handling Patterns
topics.description: Learn practical patterns for handling errors, including checking errors immediately, propagating errors, and creating custom error messages.

topics.title: Understanding Pointers
topics.description: Dive into the concept of pointers in Go. Learn how to declare, initialize, and dereference pointers to access memory addresses.

topics.title: Pointers to Structs and Slices
topics.description: Explore how pointers interact with complex data types like structs and slices. Understand when to use pointers to avoid unnecessary copying and to modify data in place.

topics.title: Memory Allocation and Garbage Collection
topics.description: Gain an understanding of how Go manages memory, including automatic memory allocation and the role of the garbage collector. Discuss efficiency considerations.

topics.title: Pass by Value vs. Pass by Reference (and Go's Approach)
topics.description: Clarify the distinction between pass-by-value and pass-by-reference in programming. Understand how Go's mechanisms (passing values, using pointers) achieve similar effects.

topics.title: Understanding Interfaces in Go
topics.description: Learn about Go's unique approach to interfaces, which are satisfied implicitly. Understand how interfaces define a set of methods.

topics.title: Implementing Interfaces Implicitly
topics.description: Discover how types implement interfaces by satisfying their method sets, without explicit declarations. Explore the power of duck typing.

topics.title: Polymorphism with Interfaces
topics.description: Understand how interfaces enable polymorphism, allowing you to write code that can operate on values of different types that implement the same interface.

topics.title: The Empty Interface (`interface{}`) and Type Assertions
topics.description: Learn about the empty interface, which can hold values of any type. Understand how to use type assertions to extract values from an empty interface.

topics.title: Introduction to Concurrency in Go
topics.description: Explore the concept of concurrency and Go's first-class support for it. Understand the difference between concurrency and parallelism.

topics.title: Goroutines: Lightweight Threads
topics.description: Learn how to launch concurrent functions using `go` routines. Understand their lightweight nature and how they enable concurrent execution.

topics.title: Channels: Communicating Between Goroutines
topics.description: Discover channels, the primary mechanism for communication and synchronization between goroutines. Learn how to create, send to, and receive from channels.

topics.title: Synchronized Data Access and the `sync` Package
topics.description: Understand potential race conditions in concurrent programs. Learn to use synchronization primitives from the `sync` package, like `Mutex`, to protect shared data.

topics.title: Understanding Go Packages
topics.description: Learn about Go's package system for organizing code. Understand how to create, import, and use packages. Explore standard library packages.

topics.title: Go Modules: Dependency Management
topics.description: Master Go Modules for managing external dependencies. Learn how to initialize a module, add dependencies, and understand `go.mod` and `go.sum` files.

topics.title: Reading Input from the User
topics.description: Learn how to read input from the standard input (keyboard) using the `fmt` package and other relevant tools.

topics.title: Working with Files: Reading and Writing
topics.description: Explore basic file operations in Go using the `os` and `io` packages. Learn how to open, read from, write to, and close files.

weeks.title: Introduction to Algorithms and Data Structures (Conceptual)

topics.title: What are Algorithms?
topics.description: An introduction to algorithms as a set of well-defined instructions for solving a problem or performing a computation. Discuss algorithm design principles.

topics.title: Introduction to Data Structures
topics.description: Explore fundamental data structures like lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs. Understand their properties and use cases.

topics.title: Time and Space Complexity (Big O Notation - Basic)
topics.description: Introduce the concept of Big O notation for analyzing the efficiency of algorithms. Understand how to describe the growth rate of time and space requirements.

topics.title: Simple Sorting Algorithms (e.g., Bubble Sort, Selection Sort)
topics.description: Implement and analyze basic sorting algorithms like Bubble Sort and Selection Sort. Understand their mechanics and Big O complexity.

weeks.title: Putting It All Together: Projects and Next Steps

topics.title: Project Work and Code Review
topics.description: Students will work on a cumulative project that integrates concepts learned throughout the course. Peer code review sessions will be conducted to provide constructive feedback.

topics.title: Debugging Techniques in Go
topics.description: Learn effective debugging strategies using VS Code's debugger and other tools to identify and fix issues in your Go programs.

topics.title: Introduction to Testing in Go
topics.description: Understand the importance of testing. Learn how to write unit tests in Go using the built-in `testing` package.

topics.title: Next Steps and Further Learning
topics.description: Guidance on continuing your learning journey in computer science and Go. Explore advanced topics, community resources, and potential career paths.
